text: October 08, 2019. Video obtained Tuesday, October 8, 2019, of Carrie Lam, chief executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, speaking at her weekly news conference. Lams says the ongoing riots in Hong Kong have affected the tourism sector. "In the past two months we see a decrease in 30-40 percent," she says. "And over the Golden Week, the National Day holiday, we see a reduction of passengers down by 50 percent. "In the hotel sector we see a 28 percent reduction rate for the hotels." (AAP VIDEO/CGTN)(NO ARCHIVING AAP VIDEO BEYOND 48 HOURS)
